definition: fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: The best wealth of man have a considerate wife.
sentences.chinese: 男人最好的财富是有一位通情达理的贤妻。

sentences.english: You cannot improve a dull booby into a man of sense.
sentences.chinese: 你不能把傻头傻脑的笨蛋改造成通情达理的人。

sentences.english: Mr Brokenshire said he wanted fans to be "sensible" and "behave themselves".
sentences.chinese: 在世界杯期间能表现得“通情达理”，“举止规范”。

sentences.english: I've noticed that a boss is usually more understanding if he has risen from the ranks .
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一个低层升上来的老板通常比较通情达理。

sentences.english: They would discuss things with us reasonably.
sentences.chinese: 他们会通情达理地跟我们讨论事情。

sentences.english: Look, David, the Fuehrer is being very reasonable. He offers guarantees.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，大卫，元首非常通情达理他提供保证。

sentences.english: He used to have a reasonable dog, the name call "yellow ear".
sentences.chinese: 他以前养了一只通情达理的狗，姓名叫“黄耳”。

sentences.english: Lady Elliot HAD been an excellent woman, sensible and amiable.
sentences.chinese: 艾略特夫人是位难得的妇女，通情达理而又和蔼可亲。

definition: see 通情達理|通情达理[tong1 qing2 da2 li3]
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
magnanimous/generous (in spirit)
educated and well-balanced (idiom)
magnanimous (idiom); generous
magnanimous/generous/broad-minded
kindhearted/good-natured
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
considerate (of other people's needs)
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
variant of 賢慧|贤慧[xian2 hui4]
rude and unreasonable
enlightened/open-minded/enlightenment
(of a wife) wise and kind/perfect in her traditional roles
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
